1. it defiantly wont be multiplayer, the stock single player experience still needs to be upgraded, and multiplayer needs better groundwork to function well.

Personally after .24 i have no idea, i Personally believe their should be direction in changes to SpacePlane parts. If budgets are added in .24, along with the contract system and repuation, SSTO's and reusable craft should be more useful as a cheap launch unit with high initial investment.

Well, if you are bad at waiting I'd recommend you buy the game in two years or so when it's finished and don't follow development for a while, i.e. forget about KSP. I doubt that the price will go up much further and squad has had trouble releasing quality updates for a while and every one of them is taking a long time to develop. If you don't want to buy the game as is now, you might as well wait till it is finished and see if you like the endresult. The development has been all over the place recently and there is no telling what the final game will be like anymore.

Don't get me wrong here, I have been playing the game since it's first release and really liked the idea of it, but recently it looks like they don't know where they are going anymore and seem to spend their resources poorly. Some great comments from people already.

But I will add: There is a lot to do now, even though it's not complete. I just picked it up in 0.23, and have almost 500 hours in it. I've been to every planet/moon, built some planes and rovers, space stations, etc. I didn't run out of things to do until I made 100% successful missions to Eve and Tylo (the hardest places in the game to land and get home from, arguably). Moho is hard too, but only in terms of packing enough fuel for your interplanetary stages.

So I guess it depends on what kind of player you are. Are you self-motivated (that is, good at setting goals for yourself, based on "meta-goals" in the game)? Or do you prefer a more linear, directed gaming experience? Until career mode gets contracts and budgets, it's still just the same thing as sandbox mode, just with component unlocking from getting science data. The goals are all "meta-goals" currently, as nothing is presented to you as a primary goal, other than just unlocking things in the tech tree.

I'm just glad they haven't said that 0.24 is coming "soon"tm
